title: UK weather forecast: Met Office warning as two weeks of rain to hit in one day

More than half a month's worth of rain could fall in some parts of the UK tomorrow, a Met Office weather warning predicts.

The official alert says the downpours will likely cause flooding, with the Environment Agency issuing five flood warnings and alerts for England.

Up to 70mm of rainfall could fall in the high grounds of west Wales tomorrow, with 15 to 30mm possible in central and north England, according to the Met Office.

The average monthly rainfall for the UK in October is 127mm.

(Image: PA)

The heavy showers are expected to move to south-east England by the evening, with the yellow weather alert in force from midnight tonight to 6pm tomorrow.

Met Office forecaster Alex Deakin said: "Into Friday we could start to see more wet weather gathering across Wales and north-west England particularly over the hills.

"The rain really starts to build up over Friday. A very soggy day for parts of Wales and also over the hills of northern England. That's an area for concern because we've seen a lot of wet weather recently.

"We do have a yellow warning in force for Friday."

Forecasters believe homes and businesses are likely to be flooded and public transport users will face delays as a result of the wet weather.

Speaking about tomorrow's conditions, a netweather.tv spokesman said: "A wriggling frontal system will bring a band of cloud and rain southeastwards across England and Wales during Friday.

"Frequent showers across the north-west, some drier and sunnier conditions in between across northern England and eastern Scotland.

"Temperatures reaching 12-15C across Scotland and Northern Ireland, 15-18C across England and Wales."

Brits will enjoy a bright start to the day this morning, although heavy rain is expected to follow in Scotland, Wales and north-west, central and south-west England.

Thundery showers are likely in north Wales and north-west England.

The rest of the country will experience cloudy conditions, with rainfall spreading across the whole of the UK overnight.

Temperatures will peak at 16C and are expected to remain in the low teens for much of the country.

Met Office five-day weather forecast

Today:

A good deal of dry and bright weather in the east, but cloudier in the west with some showers. More widespread areas of rain pushing across mainly western parts during the day. Windy.

Tonight:

Rain and showers affecting the UK, mainly western and southern parts with eastern areas seeing the best of the drier weather. Windy, perhaps with gales on west and south coasts.

Friday:

Wet for many, particularly Wales and parts of northern England. Eastern Scotland and the far northeast of England most sheltered. Windy with gales for west and perhaps south coasts.

Outlook for Saturday to Monday:

Unsettled for most, with further spells of rain, heavy at times, particularly across some western areas. Windy too, with a risk of gales, particularly on Sunday.
description: The Met Office has issued a yellow weather warning for Wales and parts of England, with forecasters expecting flooding
